_meta.name: explanation-architecture
_meta.use_case: You need to explain system design decisions

sections.heading: # Architecture Overview
sections.prompt: Explain the high-level architecture (4-5 paragraphs): (1) System purpose and goals, (2) Key architectural decisions, (3) Major components and their responsibilities, (4) Data flow overview, (5) Integration points. Focus on 'why' not 'how'. Help readers build a mental model.

sections.heading: ## Design Principles
sections.prompt: Articulate the design philosophy (5-7 paragraphs). What principles guide decisions? Cover: (1) Core values (simplicity, performance, etc), (2) Trade-offs made, (3) Patterns used consistently, (4) Patterns explicitly avoided, (5) When to break the rules. Be philosophical but grounded in examples.

sections.heading: ## Component Deep Dive
sections.prompt: Explain each major component in depth (6-10 paragraphs, one per component). For each: (1) Purpose and responsibilities, (2) Key design decisions, (3) Interaction with other components, (4) Notable implementation details. Focus on design rationale and trade-offs, not line-by-line code.

sections.heading: ## Data Flow
sections.prompt: Trace key data flows through the system (4-6 paragraphs). Pick 2-3 critical workflows and explain the complete flow: what happens at each step, why, what could go wrong. Use specific examples. Help readers understand the system's behavior.

sections.heading: ## Technology Choices
sections.prompt: Explain technology and library choices (5-7 paragraphs). For major dependencies: (1) Why chosen, (2) What alternatives considered, (3) Trade-offs accepted, (4) How it could be replaced if needed. Be honest about limitations.

sections.heading: ## Future Directions
sections.prompt: Discuss potential evolution (3-4 paragraphs): Known limitations, areas for improvement, how architecture supports (or constrains) future features. Be realistic about trade-offs. Don't promise features, explain possibilities.
